page.title: 20SCHOOL HOLIDAY.1985
page.content: This year both the 3rd and the 4th years have had a weeks working holiday in North Wales with the school. We were each given a red binder full of questionaires and pictures to colour and we filled it in when we came back. We were all very busy the week after - drawing pictures,answering questions and doing lots of writing about each place we visited.My favourite place was Trefriw Woollen Mill which rests on the river Crafnant.We went to lots of places on our visit to North Wales like Swallow Falls,Caernarvon and Conway Castles,Rhyl Sun Centre,a Slate Quarry,A Farm on Anglesey,Penrhos Nature Reserve and lots of others. The total cost was Â£52.00.Next year the group are hoping to go to North Yorkshire.
